attributes.action: Stop the new tax on "normal everyday" people selling on online platforms.
attributes.additional_details: Why should the everyday person, who has already paid tax on the item pay EVEN more tax on second hand products? If I was to sell my car for £1001 why do I have to pay tax on it? The sale of the item & so called profits from a sale does not take into account the packaging and shipping. People are using these platforms to pay for the high taxes / energy rates / TV licences / FOOD etc, Find a way to TAX the large corporates and stop finding the easy route to bail your mistakes by chasing the poor!
attributes.background: Start increasing taxing on the bigger companies that import cheaper products that sell on these online platforms, in turn stopping child labour / pollution / funding terrorism

rejection.details:
Tax rules relating to income from online sales have not changed, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Repeal "The Platform Operators Regulations 2023": https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/654278

You can find out about selling online and paying taxes here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/selling-online-and-paying-taxes/selling-online-and-paying-taxes-information-sheet
